benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId} - Retrieve an account by id

covered: Valid Request: Tests cover retrieval with default parameters (TC01) and default invocation with none (TC30) leading to HTTP 200 and an Account object with no balance, CBA, or audit fields
Empty Response: Tests cover no accounts (TC07) and non-existent accountId (TC08) yielding 404 and account-not-found messaging
Query Parameters: Comprehensive coverage of accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, and audit (FULL/MINIMAL/NONE) across multiple test cases (TC02-06, TC23-25, TC27-33)
Authorization: Tests cover missing and invalid tokens (TC10, TC11) leading to 401
System Error Handling: Service unavailability (TC12) provides 503 responses
Input Validation: Malformed accountId (TC9) and injection/XSS payloads (TC13, TC14) yield 400 and prevent data leakage
Data Size / Large Payload: Tests cover large payload scenarios (TC17)
Concurrency: Concurrent requests for the same account (TC18) validate consistency across parallel requests
gaps: Rate Limiting: No tests for rate-limiting or throttling (e.g., 429 Too Many Requests)
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers like ETag / Cache-Control or 304 responses
500 Internal Server Error: Only 503 tested; no explicit 500 scenario
Pagination: Not applicable to a single-resource fetch but no pagination-related behavior tested
Backwards compatibility: No explicit validation of header-based compatibility beyond schema (TC19)
Timeout/Performance: Limited performance-related tests; no explicit timeout SLAs tested beyond TC16
Authorization deeper: No test for 403 Forbidden when token lacks permissions
Recovery from transient network failure: Not aligned with guidelines; explicit retry semantics could be clarified
recommendations: Add explicit 500 Internal Server Error test to validate DB/service failure behavior (in addition to 503)
Add rate-limiting tests (e.g., 429) to verify throttling under high load
Add caching tests to verify ETag/Cache-Control headers and 304 responses
Add 403 Forbidden tests to ensure insufficient privileges are correctly rejected
Add explicit concurrency and load testing (TC18) with stress scenarios
Add timeout/performance tests to verify responsiveness under load
Clarify and align tests with guidelines for data consistency under degraded dependencies (TC20) and recovery scenarios
Review and prune excessive test combinations to maintain maintainability
